name: CMA (Cost and Management Accountancy) Exams
description: A professional certification course for students who aspire to become Cost and Management Accountants. The course is structured into three levels—Foundation, Intermediate, and Final—and focuses on cost management, financial planning, and strategic decision-making.
conductingBody: The Institute of Cost Accountants of India (ICMAI)

eligibility.ageLimit: No age limit to register for the course or appear for the exams.
eligibility.educationalQualification:
Foundation: Can register after passing Class 10 and appear after qualifying the Class 12 examination. 
Intermediate: Can be pursued after clearing the CMA Foundation exam or through a direct entry route for graduates in any discipline (other than Fine Arts). 
Final: Can be pursued only after clearing both groups of the CMA Intermediate examination.
eligibility.nationality: Open to all nationalities, subject to the regulations of the ICMAI.

timeline.notificationDate: Typically released 4-5 months before the exam term.
timeline.applicationStartDate: Admission is open throughout the year. However, there are cut-off dates to be eligible for an exam term (e.g., Jan 31 for June term, July 31 for December term).
timeline.applicationEndDate: Exam form filling happens approx. 2-3 months before the exam.
timeline.examDate: Exams are held twice a year, in June and December. (e.g., June 2024 exams are from June 11 to June 18, 2024).
timeline.resultDate: Typically declared within 2 months of the exam. (e.g., June term result by August 26, December term result by February 21).

stages.name: CMA Foundation
stages.description: The entry-level examination consisting of 4 papers. It is the first step in the CMA course.

stages.name: CMA Intermediate
stages.description: The second level of the CMA course, consisting of 8 papers divided into two groups of 4 papers each.

stages.name: Practical Training
stages.description: A mandatory 15 months of practical training is required to be completed before a candidate can be awarded the CMA qualification.

stages.name: CMA Final
stages.description: The final level of the course, consisting of 8 papers divided into two groups of 4 papers each. Passing this level makes a candidate eligible to become a Cost and Management Accountant.

examPattern.markingScheme: There is no negative marking. To pass a group, a candidate must obtain a minimum of 40% marks in each paper and an aggregate of 50% in all the papers of that group.

syllabus.name: CMA Foundation
topics: Fundamentals of Business Laws and Business Communication
Fundamentals of Financial and Cost Accounting
Fundamentals of Business Mathematics and Statistics
Fundamentals of Business Economics and Management

syllabus.name: CMA Intermediate
topics: Financial Management and Business Data Analytics

syllabus.name: CMA Final
topics: Direct Tax Laws and International Taxation
Strategic Performance Management and Business Valuation
